condition.description:
Shingles is a disease caused by the varicella-zoster virus - the same virus that causes chickenpox. After you have chickenpox, the virus stays in your body. It may not cause problems for many years. As you get older, the virus may reappear as shingles. Although it is most common in people over age 50, anyone who has had chickenpox is at risk.

You can't catch shingles from someone who has it. However, if you have a shingles rash, you can pass the virus to someone who has never had chickenpox. This would usually be a child, who could get chickenpox instead of shingles. The virus spreads through direct contact with the rash, and cannot spread through the air.

Early signs of shingles include burning or shooting pain and tingling or itching, usually on one side of the body or face. The pain can be mild to severe. Rashes or blisters appear anywhere from one to 14 days later. If shingles appears on your face, it may affect your vision or hearing. The pain of shingles may last for weeks, months, or even years after the blisters have healed.

There is no cure for shingles. Early treatment with medicines that fight the virus may help. These medicines may also help prevent lingering pain.

A vaccine may prevent shingles or lessen its effects. The vaccine is recommended for people 60 or over. In some cases doctors may give it to people ages 50 to 59.

NIH: National Institute of Allergy and Infectious Diseases

Drink plenty of fluids and stay hydrated while on Valtrex.
If you're taking this for herpes, use condoms and avoid sex if you're having an outbreak so you don't infect others.
Start taking Valtrex as soon as you know you're going to have a breakout.

basics.benefits_moa: Valtrex is an antiviral medication that stops viruses from growing. It shortens the amount of time infections like shingles, chickenpox, and herpes will last.
basics.bottom_line: Valtrex is good for treating viral infections like herpes, chickenpox, and shingles. It won't cure the disease, but it'll shorten the length of a breakout.
downsides: Valtrex is not a cure for herpes, chickenpox, or shingles. It will only shorten the time you have a breakout.

If you're taking Valtrex for herpes, you should use barrier methods (condoms) when you're having sex since you can still pass it on to other people, even if you're taking the medication and you're not in a breakout.

downsides_processed.orig: Valtrex is not a cure for herpes, chickenpox, or shingles. It will only shorten the time you have a breakout.

If you're taking Valtrex for herpes, you should use barrier methods (condoms) when you're having sex since you can still pass it on to other people, even if you're taking the medication and you're not in a breakout.

upsides: Used as a first-choice treatment for herpes, chickenpox, and shingles infections and breakouts.
Most people (including pregnant women) usually take the oral medication without experiencing any side effects.
Available as a generic, so it's relatively cheap.
Most people generally don't develop a resistance to Valtrex.
Works well for most people to shorten the duration of outbreaks.
You don't have to take this as often as other antiviral medications.

risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of people on Valtrex who have had serious kidney damage. This is very rare. You'll want to drink plenty of fluids while you're on Valtrex.

risks_warnings.title: Blood disorders
risks_warnings.description: It's possible to develop a serious blood disorder that can damage the liver. This is very rare and is more likely to happen in people who have a weakened immune system. Call your doctor immediately if you notice unusual bleeding or bruising, feeling very tired or weak, have dark urine, or notice that your skin or the whites of eyes have become yellow.

basics.benefits_moa: Horizant treats restless leg syndrome and pain caused by shingles by lowering your body's response to pain. It's used for long-lasting (chronic) pain and doesn't work for sudden (acute) pain.
basics.bottom_line: Horizant is a good way to treat pain since it can be used with other pain medications and it's not addictive. You'll need to stop drinking alcohol and it can be somewhat expensive.
downsides: Need to avoid alcohol while on Horizant.
Has to be taken with food.
If you want to stop taking this medication, you need to talk to your doctor first since stopping it cold turkey can cause seizures.
Not available as a generic.

risks_warnings.description: Horizant can affect your ability to drive. Until you know how Horizant works in your body, you shouldn't drive since your reaction time can be slowed down.

carousel_items: Starts working with the first dose, but full effects can take longer.
Remove the protective lining on the patch before applying the patch to unbroken skin.
Leave the patch on for up to 12 hours during a 24 hour period.
You can cut the patches to create a custom fit for the area of skin you need to apply it to.
Don't place any tight wraps or heating pads over the patch while it's on.
Make sure not to touch your eyes after touching the patch. Always wash your hands after putting it on or taking it off.

basics.benefits_moa: Lidocaine is a local anesthetic. It absorbs into your skin where it targets damaged nerves and relieves burning pain.
basics.bottom_line: Lidocaine patches work well by releasing a local anesthetic into the skin and relieving pain by targeting damaged nerves.
downsides: Can cause skin irritation after using it the first time, but for most people it's mild and goes away in a few minutes or hours.
Used patches contain enough medicine to be dangerous to children and pets, so store and dispose of the patches in a safe place out of their reach.
Might not be the best choice if you've had allergic reactions to numbing medications (local anesthetics) in the past.
Even though only small amounts of Lidocaine are absorbed into the body through the skin, if you're taking medications that treat arrhythmias, Lidocaine can affect how they work.
Patches shouldn't be left on for more than 12 hours, used on very large areas of skin, or covered with a heating pad.

downsides_processed.orig: Can cause skin irritation after using it the first time, but for most people it's mild and goes away in a few minutes or hours.

Patches shouldn't be left on for more than 12 hours, used on very large areas of skin, or covered with a heating pad.

upsides: Lidocaine can treat pain better for people who can't take oral pain medications due to allergies or bad side effects.
Has been shown to relieve nerve pain due to shingles for up to 12 hours at a time.
Patches can be cut into smaller pieces to best fit the areas of skin they need to be used on.

risks_warnings.title: Overdose
risks_warnings.description: Lidocaine can build up in the body if too much is absorbed or if the drug can't be removed correctly. Symptoms include irregular heartbeat, slowed breathing, seizures and if serious can lead to death. Do not leave Lidocaine on skin longer than 12 hours, use on very large areas, or cover with a tight wrap or heating pad, all can increase the total amount of medication in the body and cause an overdose. Older more frail patients might be more sensitive. Lidocaine is removed from the body by the liver so if you have liver disease talk to your doctor about possible changes in your dose.
risk_factors: Use of heating pad on skin
Applying patch to red, irritated or broken skin
Leaving patch on for more than 12 hours
Using patch on a very large area
Older age and lower body weight

Older more frail patients might be more sensitive. Lidocaine is removed from the body by the liver so if you have liver disease talk to your doctor about possible changes in your dose.

risks_warnings.title: Serious allergic reaction
risks_warnings.description: Let your doctor know if you've had an allergic reaction to numbing medications (local anesthetics) in the past. You could also be allergic to Lidocaine and want to be careful using it for the first time. Rarely, Lidocaine can cause serious allergic reactions (severe rash, trouble breathing) and angioedema (life-threatening condition with swelling with or without hives). Call 911 or your doctor if you develop any of these symptoms while taking Lidocaine.

Call 911 or your doctor if you develop any of these symptoms while taking Lidocaine.

risks_warnings.title: Accidental poisoning
risks_warnings.description: Store Lidocaine away from children and pets. Used patches have enough medication to cause serious illness if chewed or swallowed. Remove any used patch by folding onto itself so the medication is on the inside. Call 911 or your doctor or vet right away if you suspect a child or pet has found and chewed or eaten Lidocaine.
risk_factors: Children and pets can reach medication

risks_warnings.title: Eye irritation
risks_warnings.description: Wash your hands right away after you apply Lidocaine to your skin especially if you touch your eye(s). It can be very painful so flush your eye(s) completely with water or a saline rinse eye wash. If eye pain or numbness continues make sure you tell your doctor and have it checked right away.
risk_factors: Not washing hands after touching or applying Lidocaine

risks_warnings.title: Skin reactions
risks_warnings.description: Lidocaine can cause skin irritation including redness, rash, discoloration, bruising and blistering after using it for the first time. Most people report the skin irritation is mild and goes away in a few minutes or a few hours after applying the patch. If you notice more serious redness, burning, or blistering, remove Lidocaine and call your doctor.
risk_factors: Covering patch with wrap or heating pad

Most people report the skin irritation is mild and goes away in a few minutes or a few hours after applying the patch. If you notice more serious redness, burning, or blistering, remove Lidocaine and call your doctor.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Although Lidocaine used on the skin has less absorption in the body than if it was taken by mouth, there is still a certain amount that gets into the body. In people who have heart problems, especially irregular heartbeat, Lidocaine can work in a similar way as some medication used to treat the condition. Because of this, Lidocaine can increase your risk of irregular heartbeat especially if you are taking other medication to treat your heart condition. Tell your doctor about your heart condition before you start taking Lidocaine.
risk_factors: Using Lidocaine with drugs to treat irregular heartbeat

basics.benefits_moa: Lyrica is a nerve pain reliever. Researchers don't know exactly how it works, but it has a similar structure to GABA, a neurotransmitter that calms nerves in the brain and spinal cord.
basics.bottom_line: Lyrica works well as an add-on medicine for seizures and fibromyalgia, but it's especially effective for nerve-related pain after shingles. Not available as a generic, so it might be expensive.
downsides: Not available as a generic, so it can be pricey.
You can't skip or miss doses since suddenly stopping Lyrica can cause seizures.
Lyrica is likely to cause some side effects, including memory problems, drowsiness, dizziness, and confusion.

Has a higher risk than other pain medicines of affecting your heart rate or rhythm, so it might not be the best choice if you have cardiovascular disease (previous heart attack, stroke, fast/uncontrolled heart rate, or irregular heartbeat).

downsides_processed.orig: Not available as a generic, so it can be pricey.
You can't skip or miss doses since suddenly stopping Lyrica can cause seizures.
Lyrica is likely to cause some side effects, including memory problems, drowsiness, dizziness, and confusion.

Has a higher risk than other pain medicines of affecting your heart rate or rhythm, so it might not be the best choice if you have cardiovascular disease (previous heart attack, stroke, fast/uncontrolled heart rate, or irregular heartbeat).

upsides: Relieves nerve-related (neuropathic) pain caused by different conditions including diabetes, shingles (herpes zoster), fibromyalgia, and spinal cord damage.
Studies show that lower doses of Lyrica cause fewer side effects and still relieve pain just as well as higher doses.
Also used in combination with other medications to treat epilepsy (partial seizures).

userStories.tip: Patience.  The side effects are just temporary.  They soon will pass and the benefits will far outweigh any side effects, if any.

This is a medication that one cannot readily judge its effectiveness in just a few weeks. yes the first few days that I  was taking Lyrica I  cried as my vision was out of focus, my inability to stay focused at work was nearly impossible. As for driving,  I quickly realized that I should not be behind the wheel.   I questioned whether this pharmaceutical marvel was really all that it was cracked up to be as I felt no better and my side effects were worse.   After a few weeks I found that the ill effects has passed and i started feeling relief.   (I have a spinal cord injury that has left me with peripheral neuropathy in both of my legs and feet )  After nearly 6 years of treatment and increasing dosages carefully monitored by my pain management doctor,  I am not sure what I would do if it were not for Lyrica.
Really good medication to treat anxiety but rather expensive.

carousel_items_processed.orig: Some people feel relief from pain in a week.
Can make you drowsy or dizzy.
Don't stop taking it suddenly without talking to your doctor. You'll need to slowly lower your dose over at least a week to avoid withdrawal symptoms.
Tell your doctor if you have unexplained confusion or changes in your thoughts or behavior.
It's not safe to take this medication with alcohol or other drugs that make you drowsy.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Lyrica is only approved for use in adults. It can increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Report new or worsening depression or unusual changes in mood or behavior to your doctor right away, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes.

description_processed.orig: Lyrica is only approved for use in adults. It can increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Report new or worsening depression or unusual changes in mood or behavior to your doctor right away, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Lyrica impairs your ability to focus, think, react and can cause blurred vision. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.
risk_factors: Taking other medicines that make you less alert

description_processed.orig: Lyrica impairs your ability to focus, think, react and can cause blurred vision. Avoid activities that require you to be alert, such as driving a car or operating machinery, until you know how this medication affects you.

risks_warnings.title: Unusual swelling
risks_warnings.description: Angioedema, or swelling in the face, lip, tongue, throat, and/or other organs can happen at anytime when taking Lyrica. Get medical help immediately if you develop any head/neck swelling or abdominal pain that does not go away.
risk_factors: Taking other medications that can angioedema

description_processed.orig: Angioedema, or swelling in the face, lip, tongue, throat, and/or other organs can happen at anytime when taking Lyrica. Get medical help immediately if you develop any head/neck swelling or abdominal pain that does not go away.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Lyrica has a higher risk of affecting heart rate control. If you have a history of cardiovascular disease (including previous heart attack, stroke, fast/uncontrolled heart rate, or irregular heartbeat), talk to your doctor before using Lyrica.

description_processed.orig: Lyrica has a higher risk of affecting heart rate control. If you have a history of cardiovascular disease (including previous heart attack, stroke, fast/uncontrolled heart rate, or irregular heartbeat), talk to your doctor before using Lyrica.

risks_warnings.title: Foot and leg swelling
risks_warnings.description: Lyrica may cause swelling in the limbs. It's more common in feet, ankles, or legs, but can occur in the arms. Swelling can be worse if you are taking certain diabetes medications or if you have conditions that make you prone to it. If Lyrica does cause swelling, it should improve when you stop taking the medication, but if it doesn't do away, talk to your about other medication choices.

description_processed.orig: Lyrica may cause swelling in the limbs. It's more common in feet, ankles, or legs, but can occur in the arms. Swelling can be worse if you are taking certain diabetes medications or if you have conditions that make you prone to it. risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Lyrica suddenly can increase the number of seizures and other symptoms including: nausea, headache, sweating and diarrhea.  Talk to your doctor before making any changes to your medication. It is safer to reduce the dose slowly over at least one week before stopping medication.

description_processed.orig: Stopping Lyrica suddenly can increase the number of seizures and other symptoms including: nausea, headache, sweating and diarrhea. risks_warnings.title: Muscle pain
risks_warnings.description: Some people taking Lyrica develop muscle damage leading to kidney failure (rhabdomyolysis), however, this is very rare. Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, weakness or fever and there is no other related cause.

description_processed.orig: Some people taking Lyrica develop muscle damage leading to kidney failure (rhabdomyolysis), however, this is very rare. Tell your doctor if you develop sudden muscle pain, weakness or fever and there is no other related cause.

risks_warnings.title: Harm to fetus
risks_warnings.description: Don't use while pregnant because it can harm your unborn baby. If you're considering having a baby, talk to your doctor about other medication you can take. The same warning applies to men taking Lyrica and possible risk to an unborn baby.
risk_factors: Both male and females taking Lyrica

carousel_items: Side effects are common, but usually manageable.
Don't drive while taking Gabapentin until you know how the medication affects you.

Neurontin and generic forms of Gabapentin have the same ingredients as Gralise and Horizant, but are dosed differently. Make sure you know which form you're taking since they are used for different purposes.
Take the extended-release tablet with food.
Stop taking Gabapentin slowly over at least one week to avoid getting withdrawal symptoms.

clock.tip: Works faster and stronger when taken with food.

basics.benefits_moa: Gabapentin is an antiepileptic and nerve pain reliever. Researchers don't know exactly how it works, but it has a similar structure to GABA, a neurotransmitter that calms nerves in the brain and spinal cord.
basics.bottom_line: Gabapentin is an old seizure disorder medicine that's now used to treat nerve-related pain caused by different conditions.
downsides: Gabapentin is likely to cause some side effects, including memory problems, drowsiness, dizziness, or confusion.
You can't skip or miss doses since suddenly stopping Gabapentin can cause seizures. This is even more likely if you drink alcohol, so it might not be the best medication for heavy drinkers.

downsides_processed.orig: Gabapentin is likely to cause some side effects, including memory problems, drowsiness, dizziness, or confusion.
You can't skip or miss doses since suddenly stopping Gabapentin can cause seizures. This is even more likely if you drink alcohol, so it might not be the best medication for heavy drinkers.

upsides: Originally used to treat epilepsy (partial seizures), but now it primarily treats neuropathic pain that's caused by nerve stimulation or damage.
Studies show it's most effective for nerve pain from diabetes, shingles, and fibromyalgia (a painful muscle condition).
It's available as a generic, so it's less expensive than similar medications.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Gabapentin may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior as early as one week after starting treatment. Watch for the start or worsening of depression, suicidal thoughts or behavior, or any unusual changes in mood or behavior. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

description_processed.orig: Gabapentin may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior as early as one week after starting treatment. Watch for the start or worsening of depression, suicidal thoughts or behavior, or any unusual changes in mood or behavior. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately.

risks_warnings.title: Neurologic and psychiatric side effects (children)
risks_warnings.description: Using Gabapentin may cause emotional ups and downs (lability), aggressive behavior, problems concentrating, restlessness, hyperactivity, and changes in school performance. When these side effects occur, they are usually mild to moderate in intensity.

description_processed.orig: Using Gabapentin may cause emotional ups and downs (lability), aggressive behavior, problems concentrating, restlessness, hyperactivity, and changes in school performance. When these side effects occur, they are usually mild to moderate in intensity.

risks_warnings.title: Serious rash and multiple organ problems
risks_warnings.description: Gabapentin has been associated with a serious rash and multiple organ problems known as Drug Reaction with Eosinophilia and Systemic Symptoms (DRESS). It can be life-threatening. Call a doctor immediately if you experience: fever, rash, hives, swollen glands, lip or tongue swelling, yellowing of skin or whites of the eyes, unusual bruising or bleeding, severe fatigue or weakness, unexpected muscle pain, frequent infections.

It can be life-threatening. Call a doctor immediately if you experience: fever, rash, hives, swollen glands, lip or tongue swelling, yellowing of skin or whites of the eyes, unusual bruising or bleeding, severe fatigue or weakness, unexpected muscle pain, frequent infections.

risks_warnings.title: Driving impairment
risks_warnings.description: Gabapentin impairs thinking abilities (concentration, alertness) and physical abilities (reflexes, motor skills) needed to drive a car, operate machinery, or participate in potentially dangerous activities. Be careful.

basics.benefits_moa: Amitriptyline is a tricyclic antidepressant (TCA). Researchers don't know exactly how it works. It may change serotonin and norepinephrine activity in the brain, which regulates mood and pain perception. It also has sedative effects.
basics.bottom_line: Amitriptyline is an older antidepressant that's sometimes used to treat pain and sleep problems, but it can have more side effects than similar medications.
downsides: When used for depression, Amitriptyline causes more side effects and has a higher risk of overdose than other antidepressants. It's usually used when other medications haven't worked.
It's more likely to cause sleepiness, nausea, constipation, diarrhea, and weight gain (1 to 5 pounds) than other antidepressants.
People age 65 and older have a higher risk for this medication's side effects.
Like most antidepressants, it can cause a higher risk of suicidal thoughts and behavior for people age 24 and younger.
The first antidepressant you try doesn't always work or it can cause side effects you really don't like. You might need to try a few different medications until you find one that works for you.

Low doses of Amitriptyline start working in 45 minutes to help you sleep better.
Six out of every ten people who use an antidepressant for the first time find that it works for them.

risks_warnings.title: Suicidal thoughts or behavior
risks_warnings.description: Amitriptyline may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. Watch for worsening depression or any unusual changes in mood or behavior, especially during the first few months of treatment or when the dose changes. Report anything concerning to a doctor immediately. Amitriptyline is not approved for use in children younger than age 18.

description_processed.orig: Amitriptyline may increase the risk of suicidal thoughts or behavior. risks_warnings.title: Mania
risks_warnings.description: Sometimes, depression is the first symptom of bipolar disorder. Treating someone with bipolar disorder with an antidepressant alone can cause a manic episode (great excitement, euphoria, delusions, and overactivity). Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

Make sure your doctor has screened you for a personal or family history of bipolar disorder or symptoms, and a family history of suicide.

risks_warnings.title: Heart problems
risks_warnings.description: Amitriptyline has a higher risk of affecting heart rate control compared to other antidepressants. If you have a history of cardiovascular disease (including previous heart attack, stroke, fast/uncontrolled heart rate, or irregular heartbeat), talk to your doctor before use.

description_processed.orig: Amitriptyline has a higher risk of affecting heart rate control compared to other antidepressants. risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Dizziness and falls may occur due to a sudden drop in blood pressure when you change positions, such as going from sitting to standing. This is called orthostatic hypotension. If you're sensitive to low blood pressure, change position slowly until your body is used to the medicine. If symptoms persist, a different medication may be better for you.

risks_warnings.title: Anticholinergic effects
risks_warnings.description: Amitriptyline blocks acetylcholine, a nervous system chemical involved in many major bodily functions. Therefore, this medication commonly causes symptoms such as dry mouth, blurred vision, constipation, dizziness, and higher risk of falls.

carousel_items: Works the best when taken as early as possible during an outbreak.
Drink plenty of fluids and stay hydrated while on Valtrex.
If you're taking this for herpes, use condoms and avoid sex if you're having an outbreak so you don't infect others.
Start taking Valtrex as soon as you know you're going to have a breakout.
Can cause diarrhea, nausea, or weakness.
This isn't a cure for viral infections, but it'll help control infection breakouts.

basics.benefits_moa: Valtrex is an antiviral medication that stops viruses from growing. It shortens the amount of time infections like shingles, chickenpox, and herpes will last.
basics.bottom_line: Valtrex is good for treating viral infections like herpes, chickenpox, and shingles. It won't cure the disease, but it'll shorten the length of a breakout.
downsides: Valtrex is not a cure for herpes, chickenpox, or shingles. It will only shorten the time you have a breakout.

If you're taking Valtrex for herpes, you should use barrier methods (condoms) when you're having sex since you can still pass it on to other people, even if you're taking the medication and you're not in a breakout.

downsides_processed.orig: Valtrex is not a cure for herpes, chickenpox, or shingles. It will only shorten the time you have a breakout.

If you're taking Valtrex for herpes, you should use barrier methods (condoms) when you're having sex since you can still pass it on to other people, even if you're taking the medication and you're not in a breakout.

upsides: Used as a first-choice treatment for herpes, chickenpox, and shingles infections and breakouts.
Most people (including pregnant women) usually take the oral medication without experiencing any side effects.
Available as a generic, so it's relatively cheap.
Most people generally don't develop a resistance to Valtrex.
Works well for most people to shorten the duration of outbreaks.
You don't have to take this as often as other antiviral medications.

risks_warnings.title: Blood disorders
risks_warnings.description: It's possible to develop a serious blood disorder that can damage the liver. This is very rare and is more likely to happen in people who have a weakened immune system. Call your doctor immediately if you notice unusual bleeding or bruising, feeling very tired or weak, have dark urine, or notice that your skin or the whites of eyes have become yellow.

carousel_items: Having children vaccinated with Proquad (a combination of measles, mumps, rubella and varicella) is recommended, and just as effective as a separate injection of Varicella vaccine.
If you are an adolescent or an adult who hasn’t had chickenpox, or live in an area where a lot of people have been vaccinated, it is a very good idea to get the Varicella vaccine.
The same virus that causes chickenpox can cause shingles, so consider getting Zostavax (the shingles vaccine) when you turn 60.

basics.benefits_moa: Varicella vaccine is a live (but weaken) vaccine that protects against varicella, also known as chickenpox. Allows your body to build memory to protect against the virus, but doesn't cause an actual infection in people with a normal immune system.
basics.bottom_line: Varicella vaccine is a safe and effective vaccine for the chickenpox.
downsides: After being vaccinated with Varicella vaccine, children still have a 20% chance of getting a mild case of chickenpox (varicella).
You may get a rash or feel sore at the site of the injection.
Some people have felt tired or fussy after getting Varicella vaccine.
Some adults get a mild fever two weeks after receiving Varicella vaccine.
Since it's a live vaccine, it can't be used in pregnant or people with a weak immune system. Check with your doctor or pharmacist what'll be best for you.

upsides: Varivax is very safe. It prevents the chickenpox infection in 70 to 90 percent of vaccinated kids.
Getting vaccinated with Varivax decreases the number of days children miss school and parents miss work.
There is no thimerosal or other preservatives in Varivax.
Most people who get Varivax have no side effects.
Children who develop chickenpox after being vaccinated are less contagious than unvaccinated children.

risks_warnings.title: Reye's syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Avoid aspirin and other salicylate-containing products in children under 17 years of age and younger. Aspirin use is linked to a condition called Reye's syndrome that causes liver and brain swelling. This is rare but very serious. Let your doctor know about any nausea, vomiting, unusually low energy, or changes in behavior.

carousel_items: Needs to be taken every day for 1 to 2 weeks to start feeling better, and for 6 to 8 weeks to see the full effect of the medication.
It's important to keep taking Nortriptyline even when you feel your symptoms are getting better.
Take it with food and/or at bedtime to decrease the potential side effects.
Tell your doctor if you notice sudden mood changes or unusual thoughts.
If you decide to stop taking Nortriptyline, work with your doctor to slowly get off this medicine to avoid getting withdrawal symptoms.

basics.benefits_moa: Nortriptyline is a tricyclic antidepressant (TCA). It helps improve your mood by altering the levels of serotonin, norepinephrine, and other similar chemicals in your brain.
basics.bottom_line: Nortriptyline is a good option for treating depression, especially for people who also have problems with persistent nerve pain.
downsides: Side effects are usually manageable, but can be annoying.
Increases the risk of falls, especially when used in the elderly.
There's an increased chance of it causing heart problems, especially in people with a history of heart problems.

risks_warnings.title: Low blood pressure
risks_warnings.description: Nortriptyline commonly cause a sudden drop in blood pressure, especially when you change positions, such as going from sitting to standing. If symptoms continues for more than a week, you may need to change the dose or medicine.

risks_warnings.title: Withdrawal
risks_warnings.description: Stopping Nortriptyline suddenly may cause withdrawal symptoms such as nausea, anxiety, agitation, flu-like symptoms, trouble sleeping, and dizziness. Withdrawal symptoms usually occur within 3-5 days of stopping the medication, and go away within 1-2 weeks. Work with your doctor to gradually reduce your dose.

risks_warnings.title: Serotonin syndrome
risks_warnings.description: Serotonin syndrome is a rare but potentially life-threatening condition caused when there's too much serotonin active in the brain. Your risk goes up if you use Nortriptyline with other medications that affect serotonin (other antidepressants, lithium, triptans, St. John's wort). Symptoms include fast heart rate, sweating, muscle stiffness or spasms, fever, and confusion. Get medical attention right away if you have symptoms.

upsides: Used as a first-choice treatment for herpes, chickenpox, and shingles infections and breakouts.

userStories.tip: I have had Herpes Simplex I for over 50 years and not until I took Valacyclovir HCL was my condition ever in control.  I have tried going off this medication and I immediately break-out.  So now I am taking 1/2 of a 500 mg dose daily.  This medication works for me, no side effects either.
I take it as needed for ulcers on my lip. Just take them when I know I'll be exhausted to prevent any sores!
Take daily dose in morning and have had no side effects.

Need to take it within a couple hours of when I first feel a cold sore coming on. If I wait longer than that, it's usually too late and the cold sore ends up coming out anyway but I do believe taking it later still lessens the severity.
taken with food but not necessary. I increase dosage to treat Herpes Zoster when I feel it coming on
No side effects at all.

risks_warnings.title: Kidney damage
risks_warnings.description: There have been reports of people on Valtrex who have had serious kidney damage. This is very rare. You'll want to drink plenty of fluids while you're on Valtrex.

description_processed.orig: There have been reports of people on Valtrex who have had serious kidney damage. This is very rare. You'll want to drink plenty of fluids while you're on Valtrex.

risks_warnings.title: Blood disorders
risks_warnings.description: It's possible to develop a serious blood disorder that can damage the liver. This is very rare and is more likely to happen in people who have a weakened immune system. Call your doctor immediately if you notice unusual bleeding or bruising, feeling very tired or weak, have dark urine, or notice that your skin or the whites of eyes have become yellow.

risks_warnings.title: Confusion
risks_warnings.description: Elderly people are more likely to have more confusion while on Valtrex. Look for signs of tiredness, confusion, and even hallucinations if using this in elderly patients.

basics.benefits_moa: Acyclovir is an antiviral medication that stops viruses from growing. It shortens the amount of time infections like shingles, chickenpox, and herpes will last.
basics.bottom_line: Acyclovir is good for treating viral infections like herpes, chickenpox, and shingles. It won't cure the disease, but it'll shorten the length of a breakout.
downsides: Acyclovir is not a cure for herpes, chickenpox, or shingles. It will only shorten the time you have a breakout.

If you're taking Acyclovir for herpes, you should use barrier methods (condoms) when you're having sex since you can still pass it on to other people, even if you're taking the medication and you're not in a breakout.
You need to take this up to five times a day, so it can be inconvenient.
